meanings.sent1: She always likes to glug her water after playing outside.
meanings.sent2: He tends to glug his soda when he's really thirsty.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to glug her juice like a thirsty puppy.
meanings.sent4: The car engine seemed to glug the gasoline eagerly.
meanings.sent5: The river seemed to glug down the rainwater as if it was thirsty.

meanings.definition: A sound made by liquid being poured from a container
meanings.sent1: The glug of the water from the pitcher was soothing.
meanings.sent2: I heard the glug of the milk being poured into the glass.
meanings.sent3: The glug of the tea being poured sounded like music to her ears.
meanings.sent4: The glug of the waterfall was like nature's own symphony.
meanings.sent5: The glug of the fountain made the garden feel alive.

meanings.definition: A quantity of liquid that is drunk quickly and greedily
meanings.sent1: He chugged the glug of water after his workout.
meanings.sent2: The kids shared the glug of juice happily.
meanings.sent3: The cat lapped up the glug of milk in one go.
meanings.sent4: The glug of beer disappeared in no time at the party.
meanings.sent5: The glug of soup warmed her up on a cold day.
